DOC.brief_title: Effects Catheter Tip Location Relative Femoral Nerve Sensory Motor Function
DOC.detailed_description: Specific Aim : Research study test hypothesis differ location perineural catheter tip continuous femoral nerve block ( anterior vs. posterior ) impact quadriceps muscle strength . These result help define optimal perineural catheter tip location relative femoral nerve use continuous peripheral nerve block help guide clinical care future research clinically-relevant area .
DOC.criteria: 18 year age Willing bilateral femoral perineural catheter place subsequent ropivacaine infusion motor/sensory test 6 hour , require overnight stay UCSD GCRC/CTRI allow dissipation local anesthetic infusion effect follow morning current daily analgesic use opioid use within previous 4 week neuromuscular deficit either femoral nerve and/or quadriceps muscle body mass index > 30 kg/m2 pregnancy incarceration
